metadata.title: CVE-2022-3550 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability classified as critical was found in X.org Server. Affectedby this vulnerability is the function _GetCountedString of the filexkb/xkb.c. The manipulation leads to buffer overflow. It is recommended toapply a patch to fix this issue. The associated identifier of thisvulnerability is VDB-211051.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3550` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.4
xdmx-tools - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.4
xnest - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.4
xorg-server-source - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.4
xserver-common - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.4
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.4
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.4
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.4
xvfb - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.4
xwayland - 2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.20.13-1ubuntu1~20.04.4').
